CatDescriptText: Joseph Cook, 3925 Menlow Street, North Side, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 22, 1958, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that there will be an economic depression in near future like the one in the early thirties?" answer reads: "Definitely, I believe that. The mills are closing, the railroads are discontinuing trains, the auto plants in Detroit are closing, the steel mills are overstocked, and the automation has helped to eliminate employment to a certain extent.  There doesn't seem to be too much hope in haiting a depression."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joseph Cook wearing dark hat, diagonally striped necktie, dark knit scarf, holding items under left arm, standing in front of marble facade with store windows on either side, lingerie display on left, and necktie display with sign that reads "Neckwear 1/2 off" on right
